pr_title: test: add testing for missing coverage

timeline.message:
test: add more testing for missing coverage

Signed-off-by: Jose Nino <jnino@lyft.com>

test: add more testing for missing coverage

Signed-off-by: Jose Nino <jnino@lyft.com>

leave the envoy update for other PR

Signed-off-by: Jose Nino <jnino@lyft.com>

timeline.bodyText: This test feels quite large and it's kind of difficult to understand what suite of behaviors we're trying to exercise here. Do you know if we can isolate the specific behaviors and have smaller individual tests?
timeline.author: buildbreaker

replies.bodyText: Some of these tests can be condensed a little bit by taking the repeated parts into utility functions in the test class. I was thinking about this as I was adding more tests. Will do in a subsequent PR #794
replies.author: junr03

replies.bodyText:
I think that's great to do also (I am slightly opinionated about test utils but we can talk about that separately)
The confusion I have is more on the behavior exercised by this test (since it seems to be asserting on all the different handlers). Does this test primarily exercise a general end to end behavior of a basic stream?
replies.author: buildbreaker

replies.bodyText: yeah, it is an http stream with trailers. There are individual tests for a headers only request, one with a body, and now this one with trailers.
replies.author: junr03

timeline.author: rebello95

replies.bodyText: if you are ok with it, I will fix this in #791 to avoid re-running CI
replies.author: junr03

timeline.bodyText: I agree with @buildbreaker's comment above regarding encapsulating testable pieces so we don't have large test functions. Another idea might be to break up this file with those smaller individual tests (it's ~1500LOC)
timeline.author: rebello95
